Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to demonstrate self-control and good judgement when he poked a child in care and did not maintain appropriate personal boundaries.
Correction Narrative: The operation has placed the staff on a developmental plan which talks about boundaries with children in care as well as operational policies.  Follow up will be conducted at least ever 2 weeks.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers were not providing supervision to children in care as required by the child's service plan.  The service plan indicates that children in care must be checked on every 15 minutes and caregivers indicate that they often check on residents one time per hour.
Correction Narrative: Operation staff have been spoken to regarding supervision.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to ensure that all cleaning supplies were properly secured following use by children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation has completed a houseparent meeting which included ensuring that all direct care staff will complete a daily sweep of the home to ensure that cleaning supplies are removed and appropriately stored.  An inspection completed at the operation on 3/6/25 as well as 11/27/24 and all cottage homes were inspected.  No cleaning supplies or dangerous chemicals were observed.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were given an early bedtime for setting off bedroom alarms in emergency or non-emergency situation, which is not permitted in operation policies.
Correction Narrative: An email received from operation administrator indicated that all campus staff were re-trained regarding the therapeutic discipline procedure for the operation.  They have ensured that all direct care staff are aware of what is permitter per minimum standards as well as the operation policies.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to follow the supervision instructions for a child in care which resulted in a child being injured during a physical altercation.
Correction Narrative: Physical follow up completed on 8/8/2024 as part of inspection id 4014013.  The administrator for the operation reported that the staff involved in the incident have been retrained regarding the supervision requirements of the youth in the home as well as expectations and policies for supervision at the operation.  All house parents on campus were provided with an email describing supervision inside and outside the home.  The administrator reported that they plan to discuss supervision with all house parents when school resumes and they have their first house parent meeting of the year on 8/21/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff members chased a child in care who had taken a vehicle belonging to the operation without permission. Speeds were between 40 mph to 80 mph. The child knew he was being followed and could have been involved in a car accident where he could have been seriously injured.
Correction Narrative: An email with updated policies was received from the operation administrator.  They have updated policies to include how they should handle situations if a child leaves the operation without permission in an unauthorized use of a vehicle.  The policy states that the staff will follow the child to determine what direction they are going and will abide by all traffic laws while following and not exceed the speed limit or drive in an unsafe manner and must also notify law enforcement regarding the situation and follow any instructions provided by law enforcement.

Deficiency Narrative: One home had expired over the counter medication observed with current medications.
Correction Narrative: One home had expired over the counter medication observed with current medications.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver humiliated and ridiculed a child when he was unsuccessful completing a task.  This occurred in front of other children in care.
Correction Narrative: An email received from operation administrator stated that the staff member involved in the incident is no longer employed at the operation and was terminated immediately following the incident.  The operation has completed a policy review with all direct care staff which reviewed the areas of concern.  This information will also be reviewed during staff meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver did not release a child after the child was calm and no longer a danger to himself or others.  The child reported to the caregiver that he was in pain during the restraint and the caregiver also failed to release him in a timely and appropriate manner.
Correction Narrative: An email received from operation administrator stated that the staff member involved in the incident is no longer employed at the operation and was terminated immediately following the incident.  The operation has completed a policy review with all direct care staff which reviewed the areas of concern.  This information will also be reviewed during staff meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to reduce the risk to a child in care when a child was restrained without the presence of a second staff.  The other children in care were present and continued to ridicule the child and kick the child during the containment without redirection from the caregiver. The caregiver failed to release the child from the containment when it was determined that he was not doing a proper hold until he was instructed to do so my administrative staff.
Correction Narrative: An email received from operation administrator stated that the staff member involved in the incident is no longer employed at the operation and was terminated immediately following the incident.  The operation has completed a policy review with all direct care staff which reviewed the areas of concern.  This information will also be reviewed during staff meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to provide a safe environment and proper supervision resulting in a child in care using the hot tip of a candle lighter to burn another child in care.

A child was notified of his discharge the day before he was discharged. The discharged documentation did not have the justification for the child not being informed four days in advance of the non-emergency discharge.
Correction Narrative: A follow up was completed at the operation and the operation has updated the discharge template. The have added If not given 4 days notice, a LCCA must provide rationale for such to their discharge summary template, and they have also added a time box to be filled in on the template for when a resident is notified.

Deficiency Narrative: The storage closet utilized for recreational supplies was found to be not appropriately secured and allowed unsupervised access to children in care.
Correction Narrative: The storage room was appropriately locked and secured.  No concerns were noted.

Deficiency Narrative: 8 child records reviewed did not include information specific to the discipline techniques utilized by the operation.
Correction Narrative: An email received from operation administrator shows the information related to discipline has been added to the service plans under the section of "identified needs."  The operation stated that there will be a reference in all service plans to their Therapeutic Discipline procedure, which includes the child's preferred de-escalation techniques, as well as previous discipline which has been proven effective for the child.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to use prudent judgement when he allowed a female resident to enter the male community
Correction Narrative:
An email from the operation administrator contained a corrective action plan regarding this citation.  The staff member involved in this citation has been placed on a Performance Improvement Plan for the following 90 days which includes shadowing a more seasoned on-call worker, utilizing on call regarding additional assistance on how to handle certain situation, review of supervision and transportation procedures for the operation, as well as re-training in SAMA.  The operation also determined that the staff member may have been distracted as his child was with him during this event, and therefore may have had to divide his attention between the child in care, and his child.  The operation stated that they have updated staff members and ensured that they are aware that they must be able to preform assigned duties without having to be responsible for care for their own children. 

Physical follow up was completed on 6/22/23.  Copies of the signed performance plan were reviewed as well as a discussion with staff member's supervisor.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver used sarcastic comments in order to manage a child in care's behavior.
Correction Narrative: An email from the operation administrator shows that the staff member was placed on a performance improvement plan, which included additional trainings and bi-weekly meetings with mentors in order to assist with better developing skills related to the population that the operation serves.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff members out of 11 did not have normalcy training as required by Minimum Standar requirements.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which stated that that did not have normalcy training have now completed the training. It was done prior to them being able to work at the operation.  At the house parent/direct care staff meeting on 10/5/2022 it was discussed with that all annual training must be completed prior to the due date.  The training reminder system was reviewed and found to be working properly.

Deficiency Narrative: An electrical fan was located in the pool area near the water.

Two child's medications were not given as prescriA child was prescribed Cipro/Dexa to be given every 12 hours for 7 days.  The medication was only given for 5 days.  Another child was prescribed Clindamy/Ben Gel to be applied to the area twice daily inthe morning and evening for acne and on 9/30 and 10/1 the medication was only given once.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from operation administrator which states that procedures for distributing medications has been reviewed with house parents, including giving medication as prescribed.  The operation also updated internal procedures related to picking up prescription medications in a timely manner.  

Follow up was completed at the operation on 10/11/2022.  Medication was reviewed and found to be in compliance and appropriately administered to children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: Bleach was observed in the dish room of the facility and accessible to children in care.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from operation administrator.  She stated that following the inspection all chemicals were immediately secured.  They checked the locks and ensured that appropriate staff had a key.  Dining staff have all been reviewed on the requirement of cleaning chemicals being appropriately secured.  For the following three months, there will be weekly checks to ensure that the cleaning supplies are appropriately secured. 

Inspection completed on 9/23/22 which confirmed that cleaning supplies were appropriately secured.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver yelled and slammed a door in the presence of children in care.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from operation administrator.  The facility has placed cameras in all common areas of the home. The caregivers in the home have completed additional EBI training.  They have also reviewed the policies and procedures regarding discipline, employee code of conduct and client/adult interactions.  

Follow up completed by inspection on 9/23/22.  I spoke with a staff member and a child in care.  It was confirmed that the caregiver had been retrained regarding the policies regarding discipline at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: One bathroom was observed with a shower light hanging with electrical wiring exposed.
Correction Narrative: Follow up was completed at the operation on 4/6/22.  The previous concern with the shower has been corrected.  the operation continues to use a check list for the staff to do a thorough review of each home on a monthly basis to ensure that the homes remain in good repair.  The operation also uses a work order system where any repairs that are needed are turned in and fixed as soon as possible.

Deficiency Narrative: Overnight staff failed to use prudent judgment by leaving children at home without ensuring relief staff had arrived.  Staff authorized to provide respite care failed to follow-up when children did not arrive at the respite cottage.
Correction Narrative: During a follow up inspection 3/3/22, it was discussed that the operation has spoke with all staff, especially overnight staff, that they are to ensure there is relief prior to leaving the home.  If a relief person does not arrive or is not present then they are to contact management.  The staff member that was directly involved in this incident was seasonal, and is not employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Three children in care, ages 17, 16, and 15, were left unsupervised for 2 and a half days.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was completed at the operation on 3/3/22.  The operation has developed new protocols to ensure that during respite children are always accounted for.  The operation has also updated the alarm system to include notification to home life supervisors, which would have benefited during this particular situation.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication was observed to be unsecured in three out of seventeen homes.
Correction Narrative: The operation has reviewed medications and ensured that all self adminstered medications had the appropriate labels. The supervisors have reviewed all medications to ensure that everything is up to date.

Deficiency Narrative: Thirteen out of seventeen homes have not had a fire drill or severe weather drill within the past six months.
Correction Narrative: Fire drills for all homes with occupants have been completed.  These will be done on a quarterly basis in order to ensure that all residents in the home are aware of the procedures related to homestudies.

Deficiency Narrative: Seventeen homes were observed at the operation.  Concerns included numerous bedrooms having open food items, lighting needing to be replaced, sinks that did not properly drain, and mold in the showers.
Correction Narrative: The supervisory staff have ensure that the homes have been appropraitely cleaned.  They have changed chore schedules to ensure that the home is appropraitely cleaned.  They have provided the staff and residents with the process of deep cleaning different areas of the home.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver did not adequately supervise children in care which allowed two teenagers to engage in sexual intercourse.
Correction Narrative:
Email from Operation: Corrective Action Plan
Implemented Immediate:
Home perimeter systems - It was discovered that the south rear door of the home only chimed during the daytime hours however after the alarms are activated they functioned as expected.

On May 5, 2021  Youth Program administrators and Business Operations staff met to discussed home security systems specifically  rear and side doors alarms. It was decided that rear and side doors of the residents homes will be armed at all times.  Maintenance completed the task and notified Home Supervisors upon completion.  

Memo For Record dated 05/08/2021  Lead Home Supervisor documented a verbal conversation he had with Earl Home house parent and  reviewed the above incident with the house parent involved. This house parent was instructed by  to ensure that either visual or auditory confirmation that the resident is present and safe when completing routine 15 minute checks.

On May 12, 2021  During weekly house parent meeting, all direct care staff was informed that rear and side doors will be armed full time.

MFR dated June 21,2021  Mr. Wilsher, home supervisor reviewed Supervision and Transportation of residents procedure with staff involved focusing on active supervision and 15 minutes checks of residents.
b.	Ongoing
Administrative review of campus procedure  Supervision and Transportation of Residents specifically the routine 15 minutes checks and residents are in the bathroom.  The procedure was revised to reflect the following changes:
Supervision of Residents Inside the Home:
A. Residents are to be supervised in the home, according to their supervision levels and level of responsibility. No resident will go for extended periods of time without being seen by a direct care staff.
B. There should be frequent checks (at least every 15 minutes) on children when they are in their rooms.
C. If during routine 15-minute supervision checks, staff discover a child is in the bathroom/shower with the door closed staff will do the following:
a. Knock on the bathroom door and prompt a verbal response from the resident.
b. If the resident does not respond, staff will knock on the door a second time and then provide a warning that they will have to open the bathroom door.
c. If no answer from the resident, the staff will knock a third time and open the door wide enough to verify if the resident is in the bathroom or shower. If so, staff will promptly close the door and ask the resident if he/she is ok.
d. If child is ok, follow up with child once they are clothed and out of the bathroom regarding the need to respond when asked and notify the home supervisor or on call staff of the need to have opened the door.
e. If a child is not present in the bathroom, follow procedure to report a missing resident.
f. It is important to make all children aware of this procedure to encourage their cooperation in responding.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were not provided with appropriate supervision when at an off campus activity and were able to leave hotel rooms without staff being aware and engaged in consensual sexual behavior.
Correction Narrative: Walkthrough coducted in the cottages. Interview with cottage parents conducted and new policies implented ensuring there is an awake overnight staff during away trip.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregiver used profane language, made verbal threats, and made vulgar gestures when disciplining children in care. The caregiver engaged in a verbal altercation with a child in care and would not allow the child to separate themselves from the altercation.

A caregiver engaged in a discussion with children in care about the caregivers personal sexual activities and preferences.  A caregiver failed to maintain appropriate boundaries with children in care to include begging children in care to comply with requests.
Correction Narrative: Caregivers were released from their duties. Intervew with current caregiver were conducted.

Deficiency Narrative: Seven showers were observed to have mold in the grout lines.
Correction Narrative: The operation has ensured that all homes and house parents are aware that they need to check showers for mold.  They have been provided with appropriate cleaning supplies in order to ensure that mold is appropriately removed.  Work orders will be requested, if the mold has been treated and continues to come back.

Deficiency Narrative: Two prescription medications were observed to be expired.  One medication expired on 9/2/2020, and another expired on 1/15/2021.
Correction Narrative: Two prescription medications were observed to be expired.  One medication expired on 9/2/2020, and another expired on 1/15/2021.  The home life supervisors will ensure that all medications are checked on a monthly basis in order ot ensure that any medications that will expire are removed.

Deficiency Narrative: Weed killer was located on the porch and accessible to children in care.  A cleaning supply closet was observed to be unlocked in a recreational area of the operation.
Correction Narrative: All poison's have been appropriately secured.  There is an e-mail outlining how maintenance staff have been reminded of making sure that all cleaning supply closets are appropriately secured when a staff is not present to monitor.

Deficiency Narrative: Four beds were observed to not have appropriate flat and fitted sheets.  No additional sheets were available to place on the beds.
Correction Narrative: The operation has ensured that all residents are provided with appropriate bedding.  Home life supervisors have also accessed each home to ensure that there is an ample supply of bedding for alll residents. .

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was not supervised according to her service plan, when she engaged in a physical altercation with her roommate during daytime hours.  Her service plan stated that she was to stay in the big room and kitchen during the day.
Correction Narrative: An e- mail was received from operation administrator which stated that she had spoke with staff that were working during this shift and discussed the importance of reading each child's specific supervision plan when they begin their shift.  staff were reminded when working in a home that is not typically of their schedule that this is especially important.  All staff were informed they should ensure that they have everything appropriately documented in the homes notebook so other staff that come into the home are aware.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver rang a cow bell and sprayed children in care with water when they attempted to sleep during daytime hours.
Correction Narrative: An inspection at the operation was completed.  The caregivers have not worked since the citation.  They were spoken with regarding the concern regarding discipline in the home.  The caregiver will be trained regarding appropriate discipline prior to being allowed to perform caregiver responsibilities.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were able to go into the bedroom of the opposite sex without the knowledge of the caregivers.  This occurred during both daytime and nighttime hours.
Correction Narrative: The operation has spoken with house parents and caregivers regarding supervision of the children in care.  They are to check on the children according to the service plan, or more frequently if needed.  Overnight staff will check on the children during the overnight hours to ensure that the residents are in their rooms as required.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers were unaware that the child had an inhaler in his possession, despite it being documented in the child's service plan.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from John Hazle, Administrator Caseworker Services.  Mr. Hazle stated that he spoke with the Child Care Team as well as medical staff.  The inhaler was prescribed and a follow-up appointment was not scheduled. It appears to be something that was overlooked by casework staff.  An e-mail was sent to all casework staff and childcare team about ensuring that everyone that has interaction with the children are aware of the medications that each child is prescribed.
